trans-unit.source: An index of Azure Active Directory code samples, organized by scenario.
trans-unit.target: An index of Azure Active Directory code samples, organized by scenario.

trans-unit.source: You can use Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to add authentication and authorization to your web applications and web APIs.
trans-unit.target: You can use Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to add authentication and authorization to your web applications and web APIs.

trans-unit.source: This section links you to code samples that show you how it's done and code snippets that you can use in your applications.
trans-unit.target: This section links you to code samples that show you how it's done and code snippets that you can use in your applications.

trans-unit.source: On the code sample page, you'll find detailed read-me topics that help with requirements, installation and set-up.
trans-unit.target: On the code sample page, you'll find detailed read-me topics that help with requirements, installation and set-up.

trans-unit.source: And the code is commented to help you understand the critical sections.
trans-unit.target: And the code is commented to help you understand the critical sections.

trans-unit.source: To understand the basic scenario for each sample type, see Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: To understand the basic scenario for each sample type, see Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Contribute to our samples on GitHub: <linkText>Microsoft Azure Active Directory Samples and Documentation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Contribute to our samples on GitHub: <linkText>Microsoft Azure Active Directory Samples and Documentation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: These samples show how to write a web application that directs the user’s browser to sign them in to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: These samples show how to write a web application that directs the user’s browser to sign them in to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Use OpenID Connect (ASP.Net OpenID Connect OWIN middleware) to authenticate users from an Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: Use OpenID Connect (ASP.Net OpenID Connect OWIN middleware) to authenticate users from an Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: A multi-tenant .NET MVC web application that uses OpenID Connect (ASP.Net OpenID Connect OWIN middleware) to authenticate users from multiple Azure AD tenants.
trans-unit.target: A multi-tenant .NET MVC web application that uses OpenID Connect (ASP.Net OpenID Connect OWIN middleware) to authenticate users from multiple Azure AD tenants.

trans-unit.source: Use WS-Federation (ASP.Net WS-Federation OWIN middleware) to authenticate users from an Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: Use WS-Federation (ASP.Net WS-Federation OWIN middleware) to authenticate users from an Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: This sample shows how to write a single page application secured with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: This sample shows how to write a single page application secured with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Use ADAL for JavaScript and Azure AD to secure an AngularJS-based single page app implemented with an ASP.NET web API back end.
trans-unit.target: Use ADAL for JavaScript and Azure AD to secure an AngularJS-based single page app implemented with an ASP.NET web API back end.

trans-unit.source: These code samples show how to build native client applications that call web APIs that are secured by Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: These code samples show how to build native client applications that call web APIs that are secured by Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: They use <linkText>Azure AD Authentication Library (ADAL)</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: They use <linkText>Azure AD Authentication Library (ADAL)</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use the ADAL plugin for Apache Cordova to build an Apache Cordova app that calls a web API and uses Azure AD for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Use the ADAL plugin for Apache Cordova to build an Apache Cordova app that calls a web API and uses Azure AD for authentication.

trans-unit.source: A .NET WPF application that calls a web API that is secured by using Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A .NET WPF application that calls a web API that is secured by using Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: A Windows Store application that calls a web API that is secured with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Store application that calls a web API that is secured with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: A Windows Store application calling a multi-tenant web API that is secured with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Store application calling a multi-tenant web API that is secured with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: A native client application that calls a web API, which gets a token to act on behalf of the original user, and then uses the token to call another web API.
trans-unit.target: A native client application that calls a web API, which gets a token to act on behalf of the original user, and then uses the token to call another web API.

trans-unit.source: A Windows Store application for Windows Phone 8.1 that calls a web API that is secured by Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A Windows Store application for Windows Phone 8.1 that calls a web API that is secured by Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: An iOS application that calls a web API that requires Azure AD for authentication.
trans-unit.target: An iOS application that calls a web API that requires Azure AD for authentication.

trans-unit.source: A native client application that includes logic to process a JWT token in a web API, instead of using OWIN middleware.
trans-unit.target: A native client application that includes logic to process a JWT token in a web API, instead of using OWIN middleware.

trans-unit.source: A Xamarin binding to the native Azure AD Authentication Library (ADAL) for the Android library.
trans-unit.target: A Xamarin binding to the native Azure AD Authentication Library (ADAL) for the Android library.

trans-unit.source: A Xamarin binding to the native Azure AD Authentication Library (ADAL) for iOS.
trans-unit.target: A Xamarin binding to the native Azure AD Authentication Library (ADAL) for iOS.

trans-unit.source: A Xamarin project that targets five platforms and calls a web API that is secured by Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A Xamarin project that targets five platforms and calls a web API that is secured by Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: A native application that performs non-interactive authentication and calls a web API that is secured by Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A native application that performs non-interactive authentication and calls a web API that is secured by Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: These code samples show how use <linkText>OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</linkText><title></title> to build web applications that call web APIs that are secured by Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: These code samples show how use <linkText>OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</linkText><title></title> to build web applications that call web APIs that are secured by Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Call a web API with the signed-in user's permissions.
trans-unit.target: Call a web API with the signed-in user's permissions.

trans-unit.source: Call a web API with the application's permissions.
trans-unit.target: Call a web API with the application's permissions.

trans-unit.source: Add authorization with <linkText>OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</linkText><title></title> to an existing web application so it can call a web API.
trans-unit.target: Add authorization with <linkText>OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</linkText><title></title> to an existing web application so it can call a web API.

trans-unit.source: Set up a REST API service that's integrated with Azure AD for API protection.
trans-unit.target: Set up a REST API service that's integrated with Azure AD for API protection.

trans-unit.source: Includes a Node.js server with a Web API.
trans-unit.target: Includes a Node.js server with a Web API.

trans-unit.source: A multi-tenant MVC web application that uses OpenID Connect (ASP.Net OpenID Connect OWIN middleware) to authenticate users from an Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: A multi-tenant MVC web application that uses OpenID Connect (ASP.Net OpenID Connect OWIN middleware) to authenticate users from an Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: Uses an authorization code to invoke the Graph API.
trans-unit.target: Uses an authorization code to invoke the Graph API.

trans-unit.source: These code samples show how to build a daemon or server application that gets resources from a web API by using <linkText>Azure AD Authentication Library (ADAL)</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: These code samples show how to build a daemon or server application that gets resources from a web API by using <linkText>Azure AD Authentication Library (ADAL)</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A console application calls a web API.
trans-unit.target: A console application calls a web API.

trans-unit.source: The client credential is a password.
trans-unit.target: The client credential is a password.

trans-unit.source: A console application that calls a web API.
trans-unit.target: A console application that calls a web API.

trans-unit.source: The client credential is a certificate.
trans-unit.target: The client credential is a certificate.

trans-unit.source: These code sample show how to build applications that call the Azure AD Graph API to read and write directory data.
trans-unit.target: These code sample show how to build applications that call the Azure AD Graph API to read and write directory data.

trans-unit.source: A web application that uses the Graph API to access Azure AD directory data.
trans-unit.target: A web application that uses the Graph API to access Azure AD directory data.

trans-unit.source: A web application that uses the Graph API to access Azure AD directory data.
trans-unit.target: A web application that uses the Graph API to access Azure AD directory data.

trans-unit.source: A web application that uses the Graph API to access Azure AD directory data.
trans-unit.target: A web application that uses the Graph API to access Azure AD directory data.

trans-unit.source: This console app demonstrates common Read and Write calls to the Graph API, and shows how to execute user license assignment and update a user's thumbnail photo and links.
trans-unit.target: This console app demonstrates common Read and Write calls to the Graph API, and shows how to execute user license assignment and update a user's thumbnail photo and links.

trans-unit.source: A console application that uses the differential query in the Graph API to get periodic changes to user objects in an Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: A console application that uses the differential query in the Graph API to get periodic changes to user objects in an Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: An MVC application uses Graph API queries to generate a simple company organizational chart.
trans-unit.target: An MVC application uses Graph API queries to generate a simple company organizational chart.

trans-unit.source: A PHP application that calls the Graph API to register an extension and then read, update, and delete values in the extension attribute.
trans-unit.target: A PHP application that calls the Graph API to register an extension and then read, update, and delete values in the extension attribute.

trans-unit.source: These code samples show how to use Azure AD for authorization.
trans-unit.target: These code samples show how to use Azure AD for authorization.

trans-unit.source: Perform role based access control (RBAC) using Azure Active Directory group claims in an application that is integrated with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Perform role based access control (RBAC) using Azure Active Directory group claims in an application that is integrated with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Perform role based access control (RBAC) using Azure Active Directory application roles in an application that is integrated with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Perform role based access control (RBAC) using Azure Active Directory application roles in an application that is integrated with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: These walkthroughs use slightly older technology, but still might be of interest.
trans-unit.target: These walkthroughs use slightly older technology, but still might be of interest.
